ygData.messageBody:
The Paladin does not need to keep the SK blinded AND rooted. Blind is the
main concern, while Root is there to keep the SK from Shadow Stepping. As
long as the Shadow Knight is blinded, the pet can be killed. Once the pet is
killed, Flash of Light can safely be casted again and again. You are correct
that SKs are not weak, but it is the spell setup of the Paladins that are
made to counteract the spells of the SK.


>First of all, the paladin's spells are just as likely to be resisted as
>ours. I've been rooted and blinded before, and it's very, very difficult
to
>keep someone under both for any significant period of time. 5 rounds to
>"finish off the pet" will be more than sufficient to get out of at least 1,
>if not both. An actual problem is that sometimes pets for SKs don't work
in
>PvP. The important part of the darkness spells is the slowing more than
the
>damage. Starting a fight with siphon strength, which I've never seen
>resisted, does a 20 point switch in strength balance and gives the SK an
>advantage in melee. When the fight comes down to melee, which they all
>eventually do, the SK is going to deal more damage much more quickly. I
do,
>however, concede the paladins have bows part.
